Sports Analytics Developer:
📊 **Roadmap to Become a Sports Analytics Developer** 📊

## 🧭 Phase 1: Foundations (Weeks 1–4)
Learn what the role is about, how it fits in the industry, and explore key tools and technologies. This is where you gain awareness and orientation. 

## 💻 Phase 2: Core Skills (Weeks 5–12)
Start mastering the most essential tools, languages, or workflows needed for your role. Practice by building small projects.

## ⚒️ Phase 3: Real-World Application (Weeks 13–20)
Now that you understand the basics, start applying your knowledge to practical challenges. Work on mid-size projects or simulations that reflect actual job tasks.

## 🌟 Phase 4: Specialization & Tools (Weeks 21–32)
Go deep into your domain. Learn advanced tools, frameworks, or research methods specific to your profession. Consider picking a niche within your field.

## 📁 Phase 5: Portfolio Projects (Weeks 33–40)
Build polished, presentable projects that you can showcase on your resume and GitHub. This phase focuses on demonstrating your skills in real-world scenarios.

## 🚀 Phase 6: Job Preparation & Career Launch
Polish your resume, LinkedIn, and GitHub. Apply for internships, entry-level jobs, or freelance gigs. Practice interview questions, attend industry events, and keep networking.

## 🔁 Continuous Learning
Technology evolves constantly. Stay current through blogs, newsletters, online courses, podcasts, and by contributing to open-source or personal projects.

Frontend Developer:
🎯 **Roadmap to Become a Frontend Developer** 🎨

## 🧭 Phase 1: Understanding the Basics (Weeks 1–4)

### ✅ Learn How the Web Works 🌐  
- What is HTTP/HTTPS?  
- What is a browser and how it renders pages  
- Understand client vs server  
- DNS, Hosting, Domain Names

📘 Resources:  
- [MDN Web Docs - How the Web Works](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Getting_started_with_the_web/How_the_Web_works)  
- YouTube: Computerphile channel

## 🧱 Phase 2: HTML + CSS (Weeks 5–8)

### 🎯 Learn HTML  
- HTML Elements, Attributes  
- Semantic HTML  
- Forms & Inputs  
- Tables, Lists, Images, Links

### 🎨 Learn CSS  
- Selectors, Properties, Specificity  
- Box Model 📦  
- Positioning (static, relative, absolute, fixed)  
- Flexbox 💪  
- Grid Layout 🧩  
- Media Queries (Responsive Design) 📱  
- Transitions and Animations  
- Basic Accessibility (a11y) ♿

📘 Resources:  
- [freeCodeCamp – HTML & CSS](https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn)  
- [Flexbox Froggy](https://flexboxfroggy.com/)  
- [CSS Tricks](https://css-tricks.com/)

... (truncated for brevity)
